1.name: ARTICLE C. - PARADES, DEMONSTRATIONS AND STREET EVENTS
1.label: article

full_text:
The terms picket, pickets and picketing as used herein are deemed to include “demonstrators,” persons participating in vigils and any action primarily promoting or objecting to a policy upon those portions of the public ways not used primarily for vehicular parking and moving traffic and not constituting a parade. 
(Code 1959 , §15-35.1(j))

0.catch_line: STANDARDS OF CONDUCT FOR PICKETING ACTIVITIES.

plain_text:
CODE OF STATE

PICKETING DEFINED. (§ 12-1055)

The terms picket, pickets and picketing as used herein are deemed to include
“demonstrators,” persons participating in vigils and any action
primarily promoting or objecting to a policy upon those portions of the public
ways not used primarily for vehicular parking and moving traffic and not
constituting a parade. 
(Code 1959 , §15-35.1(j))
